comments.html:
SANs are slowly becoming a dead horse. There once was a time when shared VMs could only be stored on LUNs. Nowadays Hyper-V supports SMB storage for VMs and people even put databases on file shares.
Unless you absolutely need native filesystem access and don't want to use a layered on protocol (NFS, SMB, etc) then the entire point of SANs is diminishing as time goes.
